title: Conservation of momentum - impulse of two blocks

content.question: Blocks <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> have masses <math alttext="m sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="m sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, respectively, where <math alttext="m sub A is greater than m sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>. As shown in the figure, block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is moving to the right along the surface of a table before it collides with block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, which is initially at rest. The objects slide together to the right after the collision. How does the magnitude of the impulse of block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> on block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, <math alttext="J sub B A, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub></math>, compare to the magnitude of the impulse of block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> on block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, <math alttext="J sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub></math>, during the time of the collision?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 equals, J sub B A, end sub, which is less than J sub A B, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="0 is less than J sub B A, end sub, which is less than J sub A B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="0 is less than J sub A B, end sub, which is less than J sub B A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="0 is less than J sub B A, end sub, which equals, J sub A B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0 is less than J sub B A, end sub, which equals, J sub A B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>BA</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mtext>AB</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
